title: Whitefish

content.title: External appearance
content.content: The whitefish is a salmonid with a distinctive adipose fin between the dorsal and caudal fins. It can reach a weight of 12 kg.

content.title: Distribution
content.content: Whitefish are found in the waters around the North Pole. In Europe, it is distributed in both freshwater and marine waters.

content.title: Diet
content.content: Juveniles initially feed on zooplankton. Adults feed on invertebrates, fish eggs and small fish, mostly gudgeons.

content.title: Development
content.content: Spawns in October - December, but migrates for spawning as early as June - October. In both rivers and the sea, it prefers to spawn in areas with rocky or gravel substrates.

content.title: Fishing
content.content: Whitefish have a high commercial and gastronomic value.

fact: According to today's scientific literature, more than 59 different species of whitefish may occur in Europe and along its coasts.
